jobs.search_snippet: SLSQ426R949. We are reimagining GTM at Databricks and are seeking an AI Operations Program Manager to own the full lifecycle of AI agent deployments.

ai_analysis.justification: Exceptional alignment: proven AI agent deployment experience, GTM operations background, and exact technical skill match.

Emphasize your cross-functional stakeholder management across 60+ teams and ability to drive GTM impact through AI operations. Frame your CPF work as B2B GTM enablement—you've already reimagined go-to-market through AI at scale for a major tech company.

sustainability_analysis.justification: Strong program management and AI deployment experience aligns well with AI operations role requirements.

Highlight your technical program management skills in scaling AI solutions, data pipeline standardization, and driving adoption metrics. Frame your sustainability work as complex technical program delivery with measurable KPIs, demonstrating transferable skills in managing full lifecycle deployments, audit controls, and enterprise-scale implementations that directly parallel AI operations management.

jobs.title: Partner Development Lead, Commerce: Afterpay & Cash App
jobs.description: Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn't work together. So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, offer buy now, pay later functionality, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we've embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale. Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We're building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same. The Role The Global Payments Partnerships team leads commercialization and business development for Cash App and Afterpay's payments products. Our ambitious team develops go-to-market strategy for our commercial products, builds effective relationships with the largest players in the payments, finance, and technology industries, and drives critical results across the business. We are looking for an experienced partnerships practitioner to source and own relationships with a select list of our biggest and most strategically important partners. This Partner Development Lead will work closely with our executive leadership team to manage and grow existing partnerships that represent the biggest upside opportunities for our business globally. You'll partner directly with leaders at both Afterpay and Cash App across Product, Engineering, Sales, Account Management, Marketing, Finance, Compliance, and Legal. You'll drive a global strategy for your partners and execute on that strategy in conjunction with cross-functional colleagues. You will source and own primary responsibility for the performance of your partners, innovate at the cutting edge of payments, and deliver revenue that will drive growth for our core business. The ideal candidate will have an understanding of the economics of the payments space and deep knowledge of the payments ecosystem. This individual should also have an understanding of what will be needed to properly resource a partner strategy, and work with internal stakeholders to develop a plan for ensuring the success of a partner. A deep sense of ownership, drive, and entrepreneurship is essential. You will: Develop growth strategy: Create and implement an overarching plan and strategy for maximizing the effectiveness of a partnership, in terms of driving profitable business impact and product distribution at scale. Build relationships : Establish strong rapport with partners at every level (executive to working groups, across functions) to influence their decision-making and advance our goals. Design scalable programs : Build and project manager a partnership program that both achieves our goals and meets our partners' objectives, scaling across internal and external teams and across global regions. Commercialize payment products : Lead commercialization of new products by refining and executing our growth partner distribution strategy. Lead end-to-end partner negotiations to deliver maximum distribution of our payments products, including upsell and cross-sell of new products and features. Lead cross-functional initiatives: Establish yourself as the go-to commercial voice for our partnership strategy and most strategic partners. Provide critical market feedback to improve our product. Drive efficiencies and improvements that accelerate business impact. You Have: 9+ years of business development or partner management experience, preferably at an innovative payments company. A demonstrated track record of success managing growth partnership programs, ideally in payments or fintech. Proven ability to build C-suite relationships and navigate external organizations both to identify internal champions and to influence decision makers. You are an expert negotiator with a strong understanding of commercial contracts and complex negotiating dynamics that may be simultaneously cooperative and competitive. A hunger to tackle complicated and impactful business problems. Sharp problem solving and communication skills. You're a killer sales person and strategic thinker who comes armed to internal and external conversations with the right data and analysis to make a convincing argument. Deep comfort operating in the ambiguity of an ever-evolving product that operates at scale globally. A scrappy and humble mindset to work autonomously. You roll up your sleeves to get things done. Willingness to travel (primarily domestically but sometimes internationally) for both internal and external meetings. BS/BA required; MBA or Masters degree a plus We're working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is an equal opportunity employer evaluating all employees and job applicants without regard to identity or any legally protected class. We will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment in accordance with state and local laws and “fair chance” ordinances. We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we're doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page . Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future. To find a location’s zone designation, please refer to this resource . If a location of interest is not listed, please speak with a recruiter for additional information. Zone A: $198,000 — $297,000 USD Zone B: $184,200 — $276,200 USD Zone C: $174,200 — $261,400 USD Zone D: $164,300 — $246,500 USD Use of AI in Our Hiring Process We may use automated AI tools to evaluate job applications for efficiency and consistency. These tools comply with local regulations, including bias audits, and we handle all personal data in accordance with state and local privacy laws. Contact us here with hiring practice or data usage questions. Every benefit we offer is designed with one goal: empowering you to do the best work of your career while building the life you want. Remote work, medical insurance, flexible time off, retirement savings plans, and modern family planning are just some of our offering. Check out our other benefits at Block. Block, Inc. (NYSE: XYZ) builds technology to increase access to the global economy. Each of our brands unlocks different aspects of the economy for more people. Square makes commerce and financial services accessible to sellers. Cash App is the easy way to spend, send, and store money. Afterpay is transforming the way customers manage their spending over time. TIDAL is a music platform that empowers artists to thrive as entrepreneurs. Bitkey is a simple self-custody wallet built for bitcoin. Proto is a suite of bitcoin mining products and services. Together, we’re helping build a financial system that is open to everyone. Privacy Policy Apply See all jobs
jobs.search_snippet: Develop growth strategy: Create and implement an overarching plan and strategy ... You are being connected to our automated chatbot which utilizes generative AI.

ai_analysis.justification: Significant experience gap: role requires 9+ years in payments/fintech business development, candidate has technical AI implementation background.
ai_analysis.positioning_advice: This role is fundamentally a senior business development and partnership management position in payments, not an AI implementation role. The candidate's 8 years are in program management and AI deployment, not in partner negotiations, commercial contracts, or payments ecosystem relationships. The required skills—C-suite relationship building in payments, commercial deal structuring, partner revenue management, and deep payments industry knowledge—are not demonstrated in the resume. While the candidate shows strong analytical and stakeholder management skills, they lack the core payments BD experience, partner management track record, and commercial negotiation expertise this role demands. This would represent a significant lateral pivot rather than a natural progression.

sustainability_analysis.justification: Payments partnerships role requires 9+ years BD/partner management experience; candidate has 7 years in sustainability programs.
sustainability_analysis.positioning_advice: This role is a significant pivot from sustainability to fintech partnerships with minimal transferable experience. The position requires deep payments ecosystem knowledge, C-suite relationship management in financial services, and complex commercial negotiations—none of which appear in your background. While you have strong program management and stakeholder coordination skills, you lack the core payments/fintech partnership experience and would be competing against candidates with direct industry expertise. The 9+ years requirement and need for established payment industry relationships make this a poor fit. Focus instead on sustainability program roles at fintech companies or partnership roles specifically in climate tech/ESG where your domain expertise provides competitive advantage.

jobs.search_snippet: Strategic Program Manager - Support. Who we are. 8+ years of experience in ... AI companies · Creator economy · Hospitality, travel, and leisure · Insurance ...

ai_analysis.justification: Sales-focused roles requiring quota attainment and direct selling experience; candidate has technical/program management background.
ai_analysis.positioning_advice: This is a poor fit. These are Account Executive (sales) positions requiring B2B selling, pipeline management, and quota achievement. Your background is in AI program management, operations, and technical consulting—not revenue-generating sales. If interested in sales, you'd need to pivot into Solutions Engineering, Technical Account Management, or Sales Engineering roles that leverage technical expertise rather than pure quota-carrying positions. Consider roles like 'AI Solutions Architect' listed in this same posting instead.

sustainability_analysis.justification: Sales-focused roles with no sustainability component; candidate has program management experience, not sales expertise.
sustainability_analysis.positioning_advice: This job board appears to be for a payment/fintech company (likely Stripe) with exclusively sales positions. None align with your sustainability program management background. These roles require B2B sales experience, quota attainment, and customer acquisition skills—not technical program management or sustainability expertise. Recommend searching for Sustainability Program Manager, ESG Data Manager, or Climate Strategy roles instead.

jobs.title: N/A
jobs.search_snippet: AI Operations Specialist | Enablement. Location. New York, NY (HQ). Employment Type. Full time. Location Type. Hybrid. Department. Product. Compensation.

ai_analysis.justification: Exceptional match: current Amazon AI Ops role, proven AI deployment expertise, enablement focus aligns perfectly.
ai_analysis.positioning_advice: Lead with your Amazon AI Operations experience deploying GenAI systems with 80% activation rates and measurable business impact. Emphasize your AI enablement expertise—translating technical complexity into adoption, establishing governance guardrails, and driving stakeholder engagement across 60+ teams. Highlight your AWS AI Practitioner certification and hands-on experience with agentic workflows, RAG systems, and change management that directly parallel an AI Operations Specialist role focused on enablement.

sustainability_analysis.justification: Limited AI operations experience; role requires technical AI/ML infrastructure skills, not sustainability program management.
sustainability_analysis.positioning_advice: Emphasize your AI deployment experience at Amazon (enterprise AI tool, agentic AI for image detection) and technical skills in data systems. However, this role likely requires deeper technical AI operations expertise (model deployment, MLOps, infrastructure) than your sustainability-focused program management background provides. The 'Enablement' focus suggests internal tooling and technical support rather than sustainability applications. Consider roles that explicitly combine AI with sustainability impact rather than pure AI operations positions.

jobs.title: N/A
jobs.search_snippet: Must have worked as a Data Scientist/ML Engineer for 3 years. Has 3-4 years of experience as a Product Manager. Experience in building AI applications.

ai_analysis.justification: Lacks required 3 years Data Scientist/ML Engineer experience and 3-4 years Product Manager title.
ai_analysis.positioning_advice: This role requires hands-on ML engineering and formal Product Manager experience that your resume doesn't demonstrate. Your Program Manager experience at Amazon shows AI deployment and product thinking, but you lack the technical depth (model building, algorithm development) and PM title history required. Consider roles titled 'AI Program Manager' or 'Technical Program Manager - AI' instead, which better match your strategic implementation strengths versus hands-on ML engineering and traditional product management.

sustainability_analysis.justification: Candidate lacks required 3+ years as Data Scientist/ML Engineer and 3-4 years as Product Manager.
sustainability_analysis.positioning_advice: This role requires deep technical ML engineering and product management experience that your profile doesn't demonstrate. While you've deployed AI tools as a program manager, you haven't built ML models or served as a dedicated Product Manager. Your AI experience is implementation-focused, not development-focused. Consider roles that seek 'AI Program Manager' or 'Sustainability Product Manager' where your domain expertise and AI deployment experience would be valued, rather than pure ML engineering positions.

jobs.search_snippet: Partner directly with frontier AI labs and senior stakeholders to shape scope, resolve issues, and expand programs through execution. You Have. 4+ years of ...

ai_analysis.justification: Exceptional match: 8+ years exceeds 4+ requirement, direct frontier AI lab partnership experience at Amazon, proven stakeholder management.
ai_analysis.positioning_advice: Lead with Amazon AI Strategy & Operations role emphasizing cross-functional program execution with 60+ stakeholders and GenAI deployment. Highlight experience translating ambiguous AI initiatives into structured roadmaps with measurable KPIs (80% activation rates, $175K savings). Frame consulting work as direct engagement with frontier AI applications (Microsoft Copilot strategy, agentic AI systems) demonstrating ability to partner with senior stakeholders and scale programs.

sustainability_analysis.justification: Role focuses on frontier AI labs requiring deep AI/ML expertise; candidate has sustainability focus with limited AI technical depth.
sustainability_analysis.positioning_advice: This role requires partnering with AI research labs and likely demands technical AI/ML knowledge beyond your current scope. While you've deployed AI tools for sustainability applications, this appears to be a core AI product/program management role. Your strongest angle would be emphasizing your AI deployment experience at Amazon and Microsoft Copilot research, but significant gaps remain in frontier AI domain knowledge. Consider roles that bridge sustainability and AI applications rather than pure AI lab partnerships.

jobs.search_snippet: Experience: 4+ years in analytics, data science, business intelligence, or similar roles. Education: BS/MS degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, ...

ai_analysis.justification: Exceptional match: 8+ years exceeds 4+ requirement, strong analytics/data science background, relevant education.
ai_analysis.positioning_advice: Lead with your AI-driven analytics deployment at Amazon (80% activation, <2min latency) and agentic AI systems experience. Emphasize your SQL/Python proficiency and quantified business impact ($175K savings, 76% cost reduction). Frame your MBA+MIS as equivalent to BS/MS in quantitative fields, highlighting your data modeling, forecasting, and statistical analysis capabilities across Fortune 500 environments.

sustainability_analysis.justification: Relevant analytics experience with sustainability data, but lacks formal data science education and statistical modeling depth.
sustainability_analysis.positioning_advice: Emphasize quantitative achievements: 2.2M+ SKU data integrity work, AI tool deployment (90% efficiency gain), SQL/Python/Power BI skills, and dashboard experience. Frame sustainability data work as complex analytics requiring statistical rigor, data pipeline management, and business intelligence. Address education gap by highlighting STEM-designated MIS degree and self-taught technical skills with measurable business impact.
